cards.name: Predatory Rampage
cards.text: Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn. Each creature your opponents control blocks this turn if able.
cards.flavor:
"It is the fate of the weak to fall."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

rulings.text: Only creatures you control when Predatory Rampage resolves will get +3/+3. Creatures that enter the battlefield or that you gain control of later in the turn are unaffected.
Each creature your opponents control blocks if able, even if that creature wasn't on the battlefield or wasn't controlled by an opponent when Predatory Rampage resolved.
Predatory Rampage doesn't force any creature to attack.

Each creature controlled by an opponent blocks only if it's able to do so as the declare blockers step begins. If, at that time, the creature is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't block, or no creatures are attacking that player or a planeswalker controlled by that player, then it doesn't block. If there's a cost associated with having the creature block, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so it doesn't block in that case either.
Your opponent still chooses which attacking creature each creature they control blocks.

cards.originalText: Creatures you control get +3/+3 until end of turn. Each creature your opponents control blocks this turn if able.

cards.name: Prey Upon
cards.text: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)
cards.flavor:
"You don't find many old werewolf hunters."
—Paulin, trapper of Somberwald

rulings.text: If either or both targets are illegal when Prey Upon tries to resolve, no creature will deal or be dealt damage.

cards.originalText: Target creature you control fights target creature you don't control. (Each deals damage equal to its power to the other.)

cards.name: Primal Huntbeast
cards.text: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)
cards.flavor:
"To the unskilled, it appears as blurred patches of distorted light. Few have seen its true form."
—Garruk Wildspeaker
cards.originalText: Hexproof (This creature can't be the target of spells or abilities your opponents control.)

cards.name: Primordial Hydra
cards.text:
Primordial Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, double the number of +1/+1 counters on Primordial Hydra.
Primordial Hydra has trample as long as it has ten or more +1/+1 counters on it.

rulings.text: Consider only the number of +1/+1 counters on Primordial Hydra when determining if it has trample, not its power and toughness. For example, a Primordial Hydra with six +1/+1 counters on it that's been the target of Titanic Growth (giving it +4/+4) would not have trample.

cards.originalText:
Primordial Hydra enters the battlefield with X +1/+1 counters on it.
At the beginning of your upkeep, double the number of +1/+1 counters on Primordial Hydra.
Primordial Hydra has trample as long as it has ten or more +1/+1 counters on it.

cards.name: Quirion Dryad
cards.text: Whenever you cast a white, blue, black, or red spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.
cards.flavor:
"Never underestimate the ability of natural forces to adapt to unnatural influences."
—Molimo, maro-sorcerer

rulings.text: Quirion Dryad's ability will trigger only once per spell you cast, as long as that spell is at least one of the listed colors.
Quirion Dryad's ability will trigger if you cast a spell that's green and at least one of the listed colors.

foreignNames.name: クウィリーオンのドライアド

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast a white, blue, black, or red spell, put a +1/+1 counter on Quirion Dryad.

cards.name: Rancor
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If the creature this Aura would enchant is an illegal target by the time Rancor tries to resolve, the Aura spell doesn't resolve. It won't enter the battlefield, so it won't be put into a graveyard from the battlefield and its ability won't trigger.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +2/+0 and has trample.
When Rancor is put into a graveyard from the battlefield, return Rancor to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Ranger's Path
cards.text: Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: The forest can seem like a dense maze. Those who travel the canopy know otherwise.
cards.originalText: Search your library for up to two Forest cards and put them onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Revive
cards.text: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.
cards.flavor: Even what is lost beyond recall returns when coaxed by a dryad's hand.
cards.originalText: Return target green card from your graveyard to your hand.

cards.name: Roaring Primadox
cards.text: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.
cards.flavor:
"They're easy enough to find. Question is, are you sure you want to find one?"
—Juruk, Kalonian tracker

rulings.text: Roaring Primadox's ability is mandatory. When it resolves, if Roaring Primadox is the only creature you control, you must return it to its owner's hand.
The ability doesn't target any creature. You choose which one to return when the ability resolves. No player can respond to this choice once the ability starts resolving.

foreignNames.name: 咆哮するプリマドックス

cards.originalText: At the beginning of your upkeep, return a creature you control to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Sentinel Spider
cards.text:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
cards.flavor:
"Your first reaction may be to stand very still and hope she didn't see you. Trust me, she did."
—Endril, Kalonian naturalist
cards.originalText:
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)

cards.name: Serpent's Gift
cards.text: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)
cards.flavor: Venom is nature's way of redressing the imbalance between weak and mighty.
cards.originalText: Target creature gains deathtouch until end of turn. (Any amount of damage it deals to a creature is enough to destroy it.)

cards.name: Silklash Spider
cards.text:
Reach
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.
cards.flavor: By the time the spider comes to slurp up its dinner, its victims have been partially dissolved by acidic silk.
cards.originalText:
Reach (This creature can block creatures with flying.)
{X}{G}{G}: Silklash Spider deals X damage to each creature with flying.

cards.name: Spiked Baloth
cards.text: Trample (This creature can deal excess combat damage to the player or planeswalker it's attacking.)
cards.flavor: If a baloth isn't hungry, it's dead.
cards.originalText: Trample (If this creature would assign enough damage to its blockers to destroy them, you may have it assign the rest of its damage to defending player or planeswalker.)

cards.name: Thragtusk
cards.text:
When Thragtusk enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.
When Thragtusk leaves the battlefield, create a 3/3 green Beast creature token.
cards.flavor:
"Always carry two spears."
—Mokgar, Kalonian hunter

rulings.text: Thragtusk's second ability will trigger no matter what zone Thragtusk goes to.

cards.originalText:
When Thragtusk enters the battlefield, you gain 5 life.
When Thragtusk leaves the battlefield, put a 3/3 green Beast creature token onto the battlefield.

cards.name: Timberpack Wolf
cards.text: Timberpack Wolf gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control named Timberpack Wolf.
cards.flavor:
"The need for the pack is bred in their bones. Their true strength will not show itself for any other purpose."
—Garruk Wildspeaker

rulings.text: Because damage remains marked on a creature until it's removed as the turn ends, nonlethal damage dealt to Timberpack Wolf may become lethal if other Timberpack Wolves leave the battlefield during that turn.

foreignNames.name: Loup de la meute des forêts

cards.originalText: Timberpack Wolf gets +1/+1 for each other creature you control named Timberpack Wolf.

cards.name: Titanic Growth
cards.text: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: The pup looked over the treetops, eyeing the man who just yesterday had kicked her. Suddenly, her hunger was infused with pure delight.
cards.originalText: Target creature gets +4/+4 until end of turn.

cards.name: Vastwood Gorger
cards.flavor:
"A long and difficult incision revealed that all vital organs are housed in the head, save for a long chain of stomachs, forty in all, leading from its throat to the end of the tail."
—Mulak Ffar, Vastwood Biodiversity

cards.name: Yeva, Nature's Herald
cards.text:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
You may cast green creature spells as though they had flash.
cards.flavor: "I can call an army to my side in the blink of an eye. Best not blink."

rulings.text: You still pay the costs for green creature cards you cast.

Yeva's ability applies to green creature cards in any zone, provided something is allowing you to cast them. For example, if the top card of your library is a green creature card and you control Garruk's Horde, you can cast that card as though it had flash.

cards.originalText:
Flash (You may cast this spell any time you could cast an instant.)
You may cast green creature cards as though they had flash.

cards.name: Yeva's Forcemage
cards.text: When Yeva's Forcemage enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: "Nature can't be stopped. It rips and tears at Ravnica's tallest buildings to claim its place in the sun."

rulings.text: Yeva's Forcemage's ability is mandatory, although you can choose Yeva's Forcemage as the target.

foreignNames.name: イェヴァの腕力魔道士

cards.originalText: When Yeva's Forcemage enters the battlefield, target creature gets +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker
cards.text:
+3: Destroy target noncreature permanent.
−2: Gain control of target creature.
−9: Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker deals 7 damage to target player or planeswalker. That player or that planeswalker's controller discards seven cards, then sacrifices seven permanents.

rulings.text: The control-change effect has no duration. It will last until the game ends or the affected creature leaves the battlefield. It may be superseded by a later control-change effect.

If the damage from Nicol Bolas's third ability is prevented or redirected, the rest of the effect will still happen. Specifically, the number of cards discarded and permanents sacrificed isn't tied to the amount of damage dealt.

For the third ability, if the player is an illegal target when the ability tries to resolve, the ability doesn't resolve and none of its effects will happen. No damage will be dealt, no cards will be discarded, and no permanents will be sacrificed.

foreignNames.name: プレインズウォーカー、ニコル・ボーラス

cards.originalText:
+3: Destroy target noncreature permanent.
-2: Gain control of target creature.
-9: Nicol Bolas, Planeswalker deals 7 damage to target player. That player discards seven cards, then sacrifices seven permanents.

cards.name: Akroma's Memorial
cards.text: Creatures you control have flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, haste, and protection from black and from red.
cards.flavor:
"No rest. No mercy. No matter what."
—Memorial inscription
cards.originalText: Creatures you control have flying, first strike, vigilance, trample, haste, and protection from black and from red.

cards.name: Chronomaton
cards.text: {1}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Chronomaton.
cards.flavor: On the third night, the villagers destroyed their clocks. The sounds of whirring gears and chiming metal held only dread for them.
cards.originalText: {1}, {T}: Put a +1/+1 counter on Chronomaton.

cards.name: Clock of Omens
cards.text: Tap two untapped artifacts you control: Untap target artifact.
cards.flavor: Most clocks measure time, but a few measure everything.
cards.originalText: Tap two untapped artifacts you control: Untap target artifact.

cards.name: Door to Nothingness
cards.text:
Door to Nothingness enters the battlefield tapped.
{W}{W}{U}{U}{B}{B}{R}{R}{G}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Door to Nothingness: Target player loses the game.
cards.flavor: Only a madman could create such a door. Only an imbecile would open it.
cards.originalText:
Door to Nothingness enters the battlefield tapped.
{W}{W}{U}{U}{B}{B}{R}{R}{G}{G}, {T}, Sacrifice Door to Nothingness: Target player loses the game.

cards.name: Elixir of Immortality
cards.text: {2}, {T}: You gain 5 life. Shuffle Elixir of Immortality and your graveyard into their owner's library.
cards.flavor:
"Bottled life. Not as tasty as I'm used to, rather stale, but it has the same effect."
—Baron Sengir

rulings.text: Paying the activation cost of Elixir of Immortality's ability doesn't cause it to leave the battlefield. If you have a way to untap it, you can activate the ability multiple times in response to itself.
As the ability resolves, you'll shuffle Elixir of Immortality into its owner's library directly from the battlefield, if it's still there.

If Elixir of Immortality is in your graveyard at the time the ability resolves, you'll still wind up shuffling it into your library because you shuffle your entire graveyard into your library. If it's anywhere else by that time, including in another player's graveyard, it remains where it is and you shuffle just your graveyard into your library.

If you gain control of another player's Elixir of Immortality and activate it, the Elixir of Immortality will be shuffled into its owner's library and the cards in your graveyard will be shuffled into your library. You are considered to have shuffled each affected library (even if, as a shortcut, each player physically shuffles their own library).

cards.originalText: {2}, {T}: You gain 5 life. Shuffle Elixir of Immortality and your graveyard into their owner's library.

cards.name: Gem of Becoming
cards.text: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Gem of Becoming: Search your library for an Island card, a Swamp card, and a Mountain card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

rulings.text: You don't have to find all three cards, even if they're present in your library. For example, you can activate the ability just to find an Island card and a Swamp card.

cards.originalText: {3}, {T}, Sacrifice Gem of Becoming: Search your library for an Island card, a Swamp card, and a Mountain card. Reveal those cards and put them into your hand. Then shuffle your library.

cards.name: Gilded Lotus
cards.text: {T}: Add three mana of any one color.
cards.flavor: Over such beauty, wars are fought. With such power, wars are won.
cards.originalText: {T}: Add three mana of any one color to your mana pool.

cards.name: Jayemdae Tome
cards.text: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.
cards.flavor: A true scribe devotes an entire lifetime to the creation of a single volume, a masterpiece as unique as its maker.
cards.originalText: {4}, {T}: Draw a card.

cards.name: Kitesail
cards.text:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has flying.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)
cards.flavor: Kitesailing is a way of life—and without practice, the end of it.
cards.originalText:
Equipped creature gets +1/+0 and has flying.
Equip {2} ({2}: Attach to target creature you control. Equip only as a sorcery.)

cards.name: Phyrexian Hulk
cards.flavor: An invasion weapon of ages past, the glistening oil contained the blueprints of countless atrocities.

foreignNames.name: ファイレクシアの大男

cards.name: Primal Clay
cards.text: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

rulings.text: In zones other than the battlefield, this creature card is 0/0.

If another permanent enters the battlefield as a copy of this creature, the controller of that permanent will get to make a new choice. The copy won't necessarily have the same power, toughness, and abilities as the original.
If a creature that's already on the battlefield becomes a copy of this creature, it copies the power, toughness, and abilities that were chosen for this creature as it entered the battlefield.

cards.originalText: As Primal Clay enters the battlefield, it becomes your choice of a 3/3 artifact creature, a 2/2 artifact creature with flying, or a 1/6 Wall artifact creature with defender in addition to its other types. (A creature with defender can't attack.)

cards.name: Sands of Delirium
cards.text: {X}, {T}: Target player puts the top X cards of their library into their graveyard.
cards.flavor: It counts down your last few moments of sanity.

rulings.text: If the player has fewer than X cards in their library, they put all of them into their graveyard.

cards.originalText: {X}, {T}: Target player puts the top X cards of his or her library into his or her graveyard.

cards.name: Staff of Nin
cards.text:
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card.
{T}: Staff of Nin deals 1 damage to any target.
cards.flavor:
"I have attuned the staff to your screams so that only I may benefit from your pain."
—Volux, disciple of Nin
cards.originalText:
At the beginning of your upkeep, draw a card.
{T}: Staff of Nin deals 1 damage to target creature or player.

cards.name: Stuffy Doll
cards.text:
Indestructible
As Stuffy Doll enters the battlefield, choose a player.
Whenever Stuffy Doll is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to the chosen player.
{T}: Stuffy Doll deals 1 damage to itself.
cards.originalText:
As Stuffy Doll enters the battlefield, choose a player.
Stuffy Doll is indestructible.
Whenever Stuffy Doll is dealt damage, it deals that much damage to the chosen player.
{T}: Stuffy Doll deals 1 damage to itself.

cards.name: Tormod's Crypt
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.
cards.flavor: Dominaria's most extravagant crypt nevertheless holds an empty grave.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Tormod's Crypt: Exile all cards from target player's graveyard.

cards.text:
Cathedral of War enters the battlefield tapped.
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Add {C}.
cards.originalText:
Cathedral of War enters the battlefield tapped.
Exalted (Whenever a creature you control attacks alone, that creature gets +1/+1 until end of turn.)
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Dragonskull Summit
cards.text:
Dragonskull Summit enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Swamp or a Mountain.
{T}: Add {B} or {R}.

rulings.text: This checks for lands you control with the land type Swamp or Mountain, not for lands named Swamp or Mountain. The lands it checks for don't have to be basic lands. For example, if you control Stomping Ground (a nonbasic land with the land types Mountain and Forest), Dragonskull Summit will enter the battlefield untapped.
As this is entering the battlefield, it checks for lands that are already on the battlefield. It won't see lands that are entering the battlefield at the same time (due to Warp World, for example).

cards.originalText:
Dragonskull Summit enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Swamp or a Mountain.
{T}: Add {B} or {R} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Drowned Catacomb
cards.text:
Drowned Catacomb enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an Island or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {U} or {B}.

rulings.text: This checks for lands you control with the land type Island or Swamp, not for lands named Island or Swamp. The lands it checks for don't have to be basic lands. For example, if you control Blood Crypt (a nonbasic land with the land types Swamp and Mountain), Drowned Catacomb will enter the battlefield untapped.
As this is entering the battlefield, it checks for lands that are already on the battlefield. It won't see lands that are entering the battlefield at the same time (due to Warp World, for example).

cards.originalText:
Drowned Catacomb enters the battlefield tapped unless you control an Island or a Swamp.
{T}: Add {U} or {B} to your mana pool.

cards.name: Evolving Wilds
cards.text: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card, put it onto the battlefield tapped, then shuffle your library.
cards.flavor: Without the interfering hands of civilization, nature will always shape itself to its own needs.
cards.originalText: {T}, Sacrifice Evolving Wilds: Search your library for a basic land card and put it onto the battlefield tapped. Then shuffle your library.

cards.text:
Glacial Fortress enters the battlefield tapped unless you control a Plains or an Island.
{T}: Add {W} or {U}.

rulings.text: This checks for lands you control with the land type Plains or Island, not for lands named Plains or Island. The lands it checks for don't have to be basic lands. For example, if you control Watery Grave (a nonbasic land with the land types Island and Swamp), Glacial Fortress will enter the battlefield untapped.
As this is entering the battlefield, it checks for lands that are already on the battlefield. It won't see lands that are entering the battlefield at the same time (due to Warp World, for example).

cards.text:
{T}: Add {C}.
{1}{R}, {T}: Put a pressure counter on Hellion Crucible.

cards.name: Reliquary Tower
cards.text:
You have no maximum hand size.
{T}: Add {C}.
cards.flavor: Once guarded by the Knights of the Reliquary, the tower stands now protected only by its own remoteness, its dusty treasures open to plunder by anyone.

rulings.text: If multiple effects modify your hand size, apply them in timestamp order. For example, if you put Null Profusion (an enchantment that says your maximum hand size is two) onto the battlefield and then put Reliquary Tower onto the battlefield, you'll have no maximum hand size. However, if those permanents enter the battlefield in the opposite order, your maximum hand size would be two.

cards.originalText:
You have no maximum hand size.
{T}: Add {1} to your mana pool.

For example, if you control Temple Garden (a nonbasic land with the land types Forest and Plains), Rootbound Crag will enter the battlefield untapped.
As this is entering the battlefield, it checks for lands that are already on the battlefield. It won't see lands that are entering the battlefield at the same time (due to Warp World, for example).

As this is entering the battlefield, it checks for lands that are already on the battlefield. It won't see lands that are entering the battlefield at the same time (due to Warp World, for example).

cards.name: Aegis Angel
cards.text:
Flying (This creature can't be blocked except by creatures with flying or reach.)
When Aegis Angel enters the battlefield, another target permanent gains indestructible for as long as you control Aegis Angel. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy it. A creature with indestructible can't be destroyed by damage.)

rulings.text: If Aegis Angel leaves the battlefield, you no longer control it.
If Aegis Angel and the permanent would be destroyed simultaneously, only Aegis Angel will be destroyed.
If another player gains control of Aegis Angel, the permanent will no longer have indestructible, even if you regain control of Aegis Angel.

cards.originalText:
Flying
When Aegis Angel enters the battlefield, another target permanent is indestructible for as long as you control Aegis Angel. (Effects that say "destroy" don't destroy that permanent. An indestructible creature can't be destroyed by damage.)

cards.name: Alabaster Mage
cards.text: {1}{W}: Target creature you control gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor:
"We hold sacred the powers of light and life. Truth and honor are our greatest weapons."
—Alabaster creed

rulings.text: Multiple instances of lifelink on the same creature provide no additional benefit. The creature's controller gains life equal the damage dealt and no more.

cards.originalText: {1}{W}: Target creature you control gains lifelink until end of turn. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Angelic Destiny
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4, has flying and first strike, and is an Angel in addition to its other types.
When enchanted creature dies, return Angelic Destiny to its owner's hand.

rulings.text: If the creature dies before the Angelic Destiny spell resolves, Angelic Destiny will go to its owner's graveyard. It won't return to its owner's hand.
If Angelic Destiny is no longer in a graveyard when its triggered ability resolves, it won't be returned to its owner's hand.

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature gets +4/+4, has flying and first strike, and is an Angel in addition to its other types.
When enchanted creature dies, return Angelic Destiny to its owner's hand.

cards.name: Angel's Mercy
cards.text: You gain 7 life.
cards.flavor: Angels appear before both the blessed and the cursed, though most don't know which they are until they feel either the angel's kiss or her sword.
cards.originalText: You gain 7 life.

cards.name: Arbalest Elite
cards.text: {2}{W}, {T}: Arbalest Elite deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. Arbalest Elite doesn't untap during your next untap step.
cards.flavor: There are few things as satisfying as a good, healthy thunk.

rulings.text: If the creature is an illegal target when Arbalest Elite's ability tries to resolve, the ability won't resolve and none of its effects will happen. Arbalest Elite will untap during its controller's next untap step.
If another player controls Arbalest Elite during your next untap step, the part of the effect that keeps it from untapping does nothing. It won't try to apply during a future untap step.

cards.originalText: {2}{W}, {T}: Arbalest Elite deals 3 damage to target attacking or blocking creature. Arbalest Elite doesn't untap during your next untap step.

Flying
When Archon of Justice dies, exile target permanent.

cards.flavor:
"When we of the Northern Verge claim a mount, no peasant's nag will do. It must be as strong as our virtue, and must join us of its own will."

cards.name: Celestial Purge
cards.text: Exile target black or red permanent.
cards.flavor:
"A world without evil? Boring. Give me vile fiends to smite and banish any day."
—Sarlena, paladin of the Northern Verge

rulings.text: Lands are colorless (even if their frames have some colored elements to them). You can't target a Swamp, a Mountain, or any other land with Celestial Purge (unless some other effect has turned that land black or red).

cards.originalText: Exile target black or red permanent.

Enchant creature

cards.name: Elite Vanguard
cards.flavor: The vanguard is skilled at waging war alone. The enemy is often defeated before its reinforcements reach the front.

cards.name: Gideon Jura
cards.text:
+2: During target opponent's next turn, creatures that player controls attack Gideon Jura if able.
−2: Destroy target tapped creature.
0: Until end of turn, Gideon Jura becomes a 6/6 Human Soldier creature that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.

rulings.text: Gideon Jura's first ability doesn't lock in what it applies to. That's because the effect states a true thing about a set of creatures, but doesn't actually change the characteristics of those creatures. As a result, whatever creatures the targeted opponent controls during the declare attackers step of their next turn must attack Gideon Jura if able. This includes creatures that come under that player's control after the ability has resolved and creatures that have lost all abilities.

Gideon Jura's first ability causes creatures to attack him if able. If, during the affected player's declare attackers step, a creature they control is tapped, is affected by a spell or ability that says it can't attack, or is affected by "summoning sickness," then that creature doesn't attack. If there's a cost associated with having a creature attack, the player isn't forced to pay that cost, so the creature doesn't have to attack in that case either.

If a creature controlled by the affected player can't attack Gideon Jura (because he's no longer on the battlefield, for example), that player may have it attack you, another one of your planeswalkers, or nothing at all.

Gideon Jura's first ability applies during each combat phase of the affected player's next turn (as opposed to applying during the affected player's next combat phase). The distinction is relevant if there are no combat phases during that turn (due to Fatespinner's effect, for example) or there are multiples (due to World at War, for example).

If Gideon Jura becomes a creature due to his third ability, that doesn't count as having a creature enter the battlefield. Gideon Jura was already on the battlefield; he only changed his types. Abilities that trigger whenever a creature enters the battlefield won't trigger.

If Gideon Jura becomes a creature, he may be affected by "summoning sickness." You can't attack with him or use any of his {T} abilities (if he gains any) unless he began your most recent turn on the battlefield under your control. Note that summoning sickness cares about when Gideon Jura came under your control, not when he became a creature.

Gideon Jura's third ability causes him to become a creature with the creature types Human Soldier. He remains a planeswalker with the planeswalker type Gideon. (He also retains any other card types or subtypes he may have had.) Each subtype is correlated to the proper card type: Gideon is just a planeswalker type (not a creature type), and Human and Soldier are just creature types (not planeswalker types).

If you activate Gideon Jura's third ability and then unpreventable damage is dealt to him (due to Unstable Footing, for example), that damage has all applicable results: specifically, the damage is marked on Gideon Jura (since he's a creature) and that damage causes that many loyalty counters to be removed from him (since he's a planeswalker). If the total amount of damage marked on Gideon Jura is lethal damage, he's destroyed as a state-based action. If Gideon Jura has no loyalty counters on him, he's put into his owner's graveyard as a state-based action.

Say you activate Gideon Jura's third ability, then an opponent gains control of him before combat. You may have any of your creatures attack Gideon Jura (since he's still a planeswalker). Then Gideon Jura may block (since he's a creature). He may block any eligible attacking creature, including one that's attacking him! During combat, he behaves as an attacked planeswalker and/or a blocking creature, as appropriate. For example, he deals combat damage to any creatures he's blocking, but he doesn't deal combat damage to any unblocked creatures that are attacking him.

The first ability only affects the declaration of attackers. If a creature is put onto the battlefield attacking (thanks to Hero of Bladehold, Preeminent Captain, or the Ninjutsu ability, for example), that creature's controller may choose the defending player or planeswalker that it will be attacking in the normal way.

cards.originalText:
+2: During target opponent's next turn, creatures that player controls attack Gideon Jura if able.
-2: Destroy target tapped creature.
0: Until end of turn, Gideon Jura becomes a 6/6 Human Soldier creature that's still a planeswalker. Prevent all damage that would be dealt to him this turn.

cards.name: Gideon's Avenger
cards.text: Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a +1/+1 counter on Gideon's Avenger.
cards.flavor: "The good don't sit and wait for the evil to act. They prepare to defend. They prepare to punish."

rulings.text: If an opponent's creature enters the battlefield tapped, Gideon's Avenger's ability doesn't trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever a creature an opponent controls becomes tapped, put a +1/+1 counter on Gideon's Avenger.

cards.text: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

foreignNames.name: Protector de la ley de Gideon

cards.originalText: {W}, {T}: Tap target creature.

cards.name: Grand Abolisher
cards.text: During your turn, your opponents can't cast spells or activate abilities of artifacts, creatures, or enchantments.
cards.flavor: "Your superstitions and mumblings are useless chaff before my righteousness."

rulings.text: Grand Abolisher doesn't stop your opponents from activating abilities of artifact, creature, or enchantment cards in zones other than the battlefield (like cycling abilities, for example).
Grand Abolisher doesn't affect triggered abilities or static abilities.

cards.originalText: During your turn, your opponents can't cast spells or activate abilities of artifacts, creatures, or enchantments.

cards.name: Griffin Rider
cards.text: As long as you control a Griffin creature, Griffin Rider gets +3/+3 and has flying.
cards.flavor: After fighting alongside the griffin riders, older knights of Thune learned to admire a mount that could rip an enemy to shreds in seconds.
cards.originalText: As long as you control a Griffin creature, Griffin Rider gets +3/+3 and has flying.

cards.name: Griffin Sentinel
cards.text:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)
cards.flavor: Once a griffin sentinel adopts a territory as its own, only death can force it to betray its post.
cards.originalText:
Flying
Vigilance (Attacking doesn't cause this creature to tap.)

cards.name: Guardians' Pledge
cards.text: White creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.
cards.flavor: A dozen fighting for each other are worth a thousand fighting for themselves.

rulings.text: Guardians' Pledge only gives a bonus to white creatures you control when it resolves. Creatures that enter the battlefield later in the turn and nonwhite creatures that become white later in the turn will not get the bonus.
If a white creature that gets the bonus stops being white later in the turn, it will continue to get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.originalText: White creatures you control get +2/+2 until end of turn.

cards.name: Honor of the Pure
cards.text: White creatures you control get +1/+1.
cards.flavor: Together the soldiers were like a golden blade, cutting down their enemies and scarring the darkness.
cards.originalText: White creatures you control get +1/+1.

cards.name: Lifelink
cards.text:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)
cards.flavor: The spoils of war are not measured only in gold and silver.

rulings.text: The controller of the enchanted creature, not the controller of Lifelink, gains the life (in case they're different players).

cards.originalText:
Enchant creature
Enchanted creature has lifelink. (Damage dealt by the creature also causes its controller to gain that much life.)

cards.name: Mesa Enchantress
cards.text: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.
cards.flavor: "Scholars seek to understand the way the world is. I wish to shape the world into what it should be."

rulings.text: Mesa Enchantress's last ability will resolve before the spell that caused it to trigger.
If the enchantment spell is countered, Mesa Enchantress's last ability still resolves and causes you to draw a card.
Enchantments put onto the battlefield without being cast won't cause Mesa Enchantress's last ability to trigger.

cards.originalText: Whenever you cast an enchantment spell, you may draw a card.

cards.name: Mighty Leap
cards.text: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.
cards.flavor:
"The southern fortress taken by invaders? Heh, sure . . . when elephants fly."
—Brezard Skeinbow, captain of the guard

rulings.text: Giving a creature flying after it's already been blocked won't change or undo that block. If you want to affect what can block the creature, you must cast Mighty Leap during the declare attackers step at the latest.

cards.originalText: Target creature gets +2/+2 and gains flying until end of turn.

cards.name: Oblivion Ring
cards.text:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.

rulings.text: If Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield before its first ability has resolved, its second ability will trigger and do nothing. Then its first ability will resolve and exile the targeted nonland permanent forever.

If there are no nonland permanents on the battlefield other than an Oblivion Ring, and the card it exiled was another Oblivion Ring, casting a third Oblivion Ring will result in an involuntary infinite loop that will end the game in a draw (unless someone chooses to break it by putting another nonland permanent onto the battlefield or destroying one of the Oblivion Rings, for example).

If the exiled card is an Aura, that card's owner chooses what it will enchant as it comes back onto the battlefield. An Aura put onto the battlefield this way doesn't target anything, but the Aura's enchant ability restricts what it can be attached to. If the Aura can't legally be attached to anything, it remains exiled forever.

Auras attached to the exiled permanent will be put into their owners' graveyards. Equipment attached to the exiled permanent will become unattached and remain on the battlefield. Any counters on the exiled permanent will cease to exist.

cards.originalText:
When Oblivion Ring enters the battlefield, exile another target nonland permanent.
When Oblivion Ring leaves the battlefield, return the exiled card to the battlefield under its owner's control.
